intro: Polanisia seretii, commonly known as the Polish bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue or purple, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Polanisia seretii is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and rocky habitats.
